metadata.Title: CVE-2011-5326 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
imlib2 before 1.4.9 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (divide-by-zero error and application crash) by drawing a 2x1 ellipse. Kevin Ryde discovered that the ellipse drawing code in Imlib2 would attempt to divide by zero when drawing a 2x1 ellipse. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (application crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-5326` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libimlib2 - 1.4.6-2ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imlib2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.6-2ubuntu0.1').
